title: COVID-19 Vaccines and Therapeutics | AHA
description: This webpage is intended to help keep the field informed of important updates related to vaccine development, distribution, utilization protocols, supply chain and many other issues, through AHA-developed tools, as well as resources from the federal government and other stakeholders.
cleaned_text: COVID-19 Vaccines and Therapeutics This webpage is intended to help keep the field informed of important updates related to the progress and distribution of COVID-19 vaccines, along with the development of therapeutics for patients with COVID-19. Resources [COVID-19 Vaccine Communications and [Treatments and Medications](#treatments) [Data Trackers](#trackers) [Understanding More about Vaccines](#understanding) COVID-19 Vaccine Communications and Distribution To help advance the public's confidence and trust in the safety of COVID-19 vaccines and their distribution, the AHA continues to develop and collate resources that hospitals and health systems can use as COVID-19 vaccines become available in their communities. - View the [AHA COVID-19 vaccine communication resources](https://www.aha.org/vaccineconfidence), including videos, social media graphics, podcasts, case studies, toolkits and a playbook for rural health leaders. [Hear from health care workers](https://www.aha.org/mywhy)about the importance of getting vaccinated. - View the [CDC Vaccinate with Confidence resources](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/vaccinate-with-confidence.html?), including how to address misinformation, strategies for communicating with patients and parents and a vaccine confidence data tracker. - View the HHS COVID-19 Public Education Campaign [We Can Do This](https://wecandothis.hhs.gov/). - View the [CDC COVID-19 Vaccination Clinical & Professional Resources](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/index.html). - Direct patients to the [AHA's consumer-focused vaccination webpage](https://www.aha.org/vaccine). Treatments and Medications For health care professionals: [CDC: Interim Clinical Considerations for COVID-19 Treatment in Outpatients](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/hcp/clinical-care/outpatient-treatment-overview.html) [NIH: COVID-19 Treatment Guidelines](https://www.covid19treatmentguidelines.nih.gov/) [NIH: Therapeutic Management of Nonhospitalized Adults With COVID-19](https://www.covid19treatmentguidelines.nih.gov/management/clinical-management/nonhospitalized-adults--therapeutic-management/) [NIH: Therapeutic Management of Hospitalized Adults With COVID-19](https://www.covid19treatmentguidelines.nih.gov/management/clinical-management/hospitalized-adults--therapeutic-management/) Data Trackers [CDC Data Tracker](https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/), including cases, deaths, hospitalizations and vaccinations. [CDC: COVID-19 Data Tracker - Variants](https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/) [AHA: COVID-19 Hospital Bed Occupancy Projection Tool](https://metricvu.aha.org/dashboard/covid-bed-shortage-detection-tool)(IHME data) [IHME: COVID-19 Projections](https://covid19.healthdata.org/global?view=social-distancing&&tab=trend)(global and U.S.), including cases, deaths, hospitalizations and vaccinations. [CDC: COVID-19 Community Level Transmission Maps](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/your-health/covid-by-county.html) [NY Times: Coronavirus Vaccine Tracker](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/science/coronavirus-vaccine-tracker.html) Understanding More about Vaccines [CDC: Understanding How COVID-19 Vaccines Work](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/how-they-work.html) [FDA: Vaccine Facts - The Path for a COVID-19 Vaccine from Research to Emergency Use Authorization](https://www.aha.org/system/files/media/file/2022/04/COVID-Vaccine-Infographic_FDA_ID.pdf) [COVID-19 Vaccine Primer](/system/files/media/file/2020/09/aha-covid19-vaccine-primer0921.pdf) [HHS, CDC: Vaccine Life Cycle](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccinesafety/pdf/Vaccine-Safety-Process-508.pdf)- Outlines the vaccine life cycle and safety steps at each phase. Latest AHA Vaccine Coverage Disclaimer: The information provided on this page is based on guidance from the [Centers for Disease Control (CDC)](https://www.cdc.gov/) and is not intended to be a substitute for professional medical diagnosis or treatment. Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with questions regarding a medical condition. Join United Against the Flu as we send a loud message across social platforms to protect yourself and your family by getting a flu vaccination.
